description: [Ethiopian Herald] - Developed countries are not fulfilling their commitments to provide sufficient financial support for climate change action, according to Ethiopia's Ministry of Water and Energy (MoWE).
title: Africa: Developed Countries Failing On Climate Change Financial Commitments - Mowe

description: [Ethiopian Herald] - African political parties, which gathered in Acra, Ghana, for the African Political Parties Summit 2025, have pledged to ensure inclusivity and democracy as driving engines of Africa's future.
title: Africa: African Political Parties Set Sights On Inclusive Democracy

description: [Algerie Presse Service] Algiers -- Algeria will host on September 4-10 the 4th Intra-African Trade Fair (IATF 2025) with the ambition of making this event a real lever for boosting trade, attract investments and foster the economic integration of the continent.
title: Africa: IATF 2025 - Algeria Aims for Breakthrough Success to Boost Trade in Africa

description: [Premium Times] They noted that while cold drinks are generally safe and hydrating, they could trigger discomfort or worsen symptoms in individuals with underlying medical challenges
title: Africa: Experts Caution Adults On Consumption of Cold Drinks

description: [Shabelle] Cape Town, South Africa -- A high-level delegation from the Federal Government of Somalia, led by the country's Second Deputy Prime Minister, Jibril Abdirashid Haji Abdi, is currently in Cape Town to attend the Africa Water Investment Summit.
title: Africa: Somali Delegation Attends Africa Water Investment Summit in Cape Town

description: [Nigeria Health Watch] In West Africa, Lassa fever remains a persistent and recurring health threat, causing hundreds of lives each year and underscoring urgent need for sustained investment in research and vaccine manufacturing capacity. In the first five months of 2025 alone, Nigeria reported over 717 confirmed cases and 138 deaths, highlighting the escalating risk and the critical importance of vaccine preparedness.
title: West Africa: Strengthening Lassa Fever Vaccine Research and Trial Capacity in West Africa

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- With the Confederation of African Football (CAF) reducing Kasarani Stadium's capacity to 27,000 due to security concerns, the government has designated six official fan zones across Nairobi to manage the overflow of ticketless fans during the ongoing African Nations Championships (CHAN).
title: Africa: Fan Zones Should Be About More Than Keeping Ticketless CHAN Fans Away From Kasarani
